meanings.definition: A person who supports or belongs to the established order or ruling class.
meanings.sent1: The establishmentarians gathered to discuss the new policies.
meanings.sent2: She was known as an establishmentarian for her loyalty to tradition.
meanings.sent3: The establishmentarians decided to have a fancy dress party to shake things up.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, he was the establishmentarian lion among sheep.
meanings.sent5: The establishmentarians' influence in politics was undeniable.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the established order or ruling class.
meanings.sent1: The establishmentarian policies were deeply rooted in tradition.
meanings.sent2: Her elegant attire reflected her establishmentarian background.
meanings.sent3: The establishmentarian decor of the room gave it a sense of grandeur.
meanings.sent4: The establishmentarian mindset was evident in their conservative approach.
meanings.sent5: The establishmentarian culture permeated every aspect of their lives.
